Description: Rim, body and handle sherd (mended from four fragments and added plaster) of South Ionian pottery cup with sharply everted rim; interior glazed (fired brown and partly worn); exterior: reserved save for band near top of shoulder and top of handle; inscription on exterior. Very micaceous clay.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, 246, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd. Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 11. Very few Type 11 cups were found at Naukratis and Schlotzhauer suggests that these may have been made in specific workshops that rarely exported vases to Naukratis. The place of production of Type 11 South Ionian cups is determined as Miletus based on the results of NAA analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen, Bonn, on another sherd (British Museum 1886,0401.570) from Naukratis and of same shape, decoration, and fabric.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 246)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 663, no. 207)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.157) (Phase 3)
